intro: Trommsdorffia maculata subsp. pelivanovicii, commonly known as the spotted trommsdorffia, is a rare and striking member of the Aizoaceae family. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring. Native to the arid regions of southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and valuable plant in botanical collections.
